intro: Keerlia bellidifolia, commonly known as the bellflower keerlia, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Keerlia bellidifolia is often found in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
